TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ElementPosition extends System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartElement

Docs.summary: Represents the base class for many visual elements of the chart such as the legend, title, and chart areas. Defines the position of the chart element in relative coordinates, which range from (0,0) to (100,100).

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ElementPosition class is used to define the position of a chart element, and represents one rectangle using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.X%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Y%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Width%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Height%2A> properties.
The ElementPosition class is always exposed as a `Position` property, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.Position%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Position%2A>, and so forth. It is also exposed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.PrePaint> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.PostPaint> events of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control as a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartPaintEventArgs> object.
The position of the applicable chart elements can be set automatically by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto%2A> property to `true`; chart elements can also be positioned at design time in the Design View.
There are two major differences between this class and a <xref:System.Drawing.RectangleF> structure:
- This class can use automatic positioning.
- This class only uses coordinates ranging from 0 to 100, otherwise an exception is thrown.
The position of chart elements is described using relative coordinates, with the top-left corner of an element having coordinates of (0,0) and the bottom-right corner of an element having coordinates of (100,100).
Elements that are plotted within a chart area use coordinates that are relative to the chart area, whereas elements outside a chart area use coordinates that are relative to the chart image.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public ElementPosition (float x, float y, float width, float height);

Docs.param: The relative X-coordinate of the top-left corner of an applicable chart element.
The relative Y-coordinate of the top-left corner of an applicable chart element.
The width of the chart element.
The height of the chart element.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified , , and parameters.
Gets or sets a flag that determines whether an applicable chart element will be positioned automatically by the control.
Docs.value: if the chart element will be positioned automatically by the chart control; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this property to automatically position a chart element. For example, to position the legend automatically, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.Position%2A> property to Auto.

Docs.summary: Gets the bottom position of a chart element, in relative coordinates.
Docs.value: A value that represents the bottom position of the chart element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The bottom of the chart element is always expressed in relative coordinates, and is either relative to a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object if plotted within a chart area, or relative to the entire chart image if plotted outside of a chart area element.
Chart coordinates use (0,0) for a top-left corner, and (100,100) for a bottom-right corner.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void FromRectangleF(valuetype System.Drawing.RectangleF rect) cil managed

Docs.param: A structure used to initialize the element position object.
Docs.summary: Initializes an object from a structure.
Gets or sets the height of a chart element.
Docs.value: A value that represents the height of the chart element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Always uses relative coordinates. If you set a value outside of the 0-100 pixel range, an exception will be thrown.

Docs.summary: Gets the position of the right side of a chart element, in relative coordinates.
Docs.value: A value that represents the position of the right side of a chart element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Returns a value that represents the relative position of the right side of an applicable chart element.
The right side position is always expressed in relative coordinates, and is either relative to a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object if plotted within a chart area, or relative to the entire chart image if plotted outside of a chart area element.
Chart coordinates use (0,0) for a top-left corner, and (100,100) for a bottom-right corner.

Docs.summary: Gets the size of a chart element.
Docs.value: A value that represents the size of a chart element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.Drawing.RectangleF ToRectangleF() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the coordinates of an object.
Docs.returns: A structure that represents the coordinates of an element position object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method converts the position of an element to a <xref:System.Drawing.RectangleF> structure.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the width of a chart element.
Docs.value: A value that represents the width of a chart element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property always uses relative coordinates; if you set a value outside the 0-100 pixel range, an exception will be thrown.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the relative X-coordinate of the top-left corner of an applicable chart element.
Docs.value: A value that represents the X-coordinate of the top-left corner of an applicable chart element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The X property is always expressed in relative coordinates, and is either relative to a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object if plotted within a chart area, or relative to the entire chart image if plotted outside of a chart area element.
This property always uses relative coordinates; if you set a value outside the 0-100 pixel range, an exception will be thrown.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the relative Y-coordinate of the top-left corner of an applicable chart element.
Docs.value: A value that represents the Y-coordinate of the top-left corner of an applicable chart element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Y property is always expressed in relative coordinates, and is either relative to a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object if plotted within a chart area, or relative to the entire chart image if plotted outside of a chart area element.
This property always uses relative coordinates; if you set a value outside the 0-100 pixel range, an exception will be thrown.
